references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces latent diffusion models, a key architecture for high-quality image generation which serves as foundation for ColorFlow.
This work introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models, a fundamental framework for generative modeling that underpins ColorFlow.

references.paper_title: Scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper proposes a more advanced diffusion model that ColorFlow can be adapted to use in future work to further enhance performance.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This work introduces CLIP, a model used by ColorFlow for image encoding and measuring image similarity.

references.paper_title: LoRA: Low-rank adaptation of large language models
references.reason: This paper introduces Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA), a parameter-efficient fine-tuning technique that ColorFlow utilizes.
